properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 9:10AM CST until January 14 at 1:23PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a
flood warning for the following river in Missouri...

Current River near Doniphan

.Heavy rainfall over the last 36 hours has caused water levels
on the Current River to rise. Minor flooding is forecast to begin
near Doniphan Sunday afternoon with a crest of 15.5 feet midday
Monday. The river will fall below flood stage Tuesday morning.

The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Current River near Doniphan.
* from Sunday afternoon to Tuesday afternoon.
* At  8:30 AM Saturday the stage was 7.5 feet.
* Flood Stage is 13.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by tomorrow early afternoon and
continue to rise to near 15.5 feet by Monday early afternoon. The
river will fall below flood stage by Tuesday morning.
* Impact...At 17.0 Feet...Water flows across Jefferson Street.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
